main event: A glowing unidentified object was observed in the northwest, accompanied by a low humming sound and varying colors over a duration of 5 minutes on May 11, 1963.
interesting points: The object exhibited behavior such as appearing, disappearing, and moving around,The object changed colors from white to reddish-orange and appeared metallic,It was estimated to be about 30-40 feet in diameter at an altitude of approximately 3000 feet,The object had no visible means of propulsion and produced no sound,There were no other aircraft in the area during the sighting.
witness description: Dr. J. Allen observed the object along with additional unidentified witnesses.
